title: PlayStation Announces Toys and Shoes - Kinda Funny Games Daily 01.22.18
description:
Tim and Andy discuss why Monster Hunter World isn't on Switch, Dragon Ball FighterZ review scores, and the new PlayStation toys and shoes.

Thanks to eHarmony for sponsoring this episode. Go to https://eHarmony.com and use Promo code: Games

Thanks to Me Undies for sponsoring this episode. Go to https://MeUndies.com/Morning and use Promo code: Games and get 20% off a matching pair of MeUndies for you and your partner
  
                                     -  The Roper Report   -
00:02:00 - The Directors of Monster Hunter World try to explain why it’s not coming to switch (IGN)
00:06:05 - Dragon Ball FighterZ 87 on MetaCritic
00:09:46 - Former Sonic team head Yuji Naka has joined Square Enix (Polygon)
00:12:45 - PlayStation figures called Totaku (ResetEra)
00:17:55 - PLayStation Shoes PG2 (The Verge)
00:23:02 - A good look at official post FFX-2 character art (Kotaku)
00:25:50 - The official list of upcoming games
 Reader mail   -
00:34:00 - What about Minecraft and Mojang? - Gamex173
00:36:18 - Smash Bros new release or a port from the WiiU one - DanM
00:39:30 - do you think nintendo are starting to slowly go away from 3DS? - Jarryd Howard
00:40:58 - What are your most anticipated games? - Javier Bonet Ruiz
00:44:29 - Do you think publishers are waiting on rockstar to announce the release date for RDR2 before announcing anything to avoid a delay or pushing the game forward? - Daniel McCrorie
00:45:40 - Metal Gear Survive Beta (multiplayer only) not bad? - Mark
00:48:30 - Squad Up - Eduardo: Sonorith (PS4)
00:50:00 - You‘re Wrong
Tomorrow’s host: Tim and Andrea


Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/kindafunnygames?sub_confirmation=1

Support us and get the shows early here! http://www.patreon.com/kindafunnygames

Check out our store! http://www.kindafunny.com/store

Follow us on Twitter!
Tim - http://www.twitter.com/TimGettys
Greg - http://www.twitter.com/GameOverGreggy
Kinda Funny - http://www.twitter.com/KindaFunnyVids

Every day Greg Miller and Tim Gettys talk about the biggest stories in Video Games.

Background Wall Art by Orioto - https://www.facebook.com/OriotoPosters/
